== Who I am ==

My name is Wei-Lin Chang, and I have been a member of the Ubuntu Kernel Team
since August 2024.

I am currently responsible for maintaining the Ubuntu Xilinx kernel, and I have also done some research in Linux KVM ARM. I obtained my Master's degree in Computer Science from National Taiwan University in 2023.

== My Ubuntu story ==

I first encountered Ubuntu in 2016 when I was learning about Linux. This marked my initial exploration into the world of Linux.

During my graduate studies, many of my experiments also required running in a Linux environment, and I continued to use the excellent Ubuntu system throughout the kernel development process.

Since joining Canonical, Ubuntu has become the default operating system on my laptop.

=== My involvement ===

I am currently responsible for tasks such as Xilinx partner engineering and Xilinx kernel maintenance.

==== General feedback ====

I have been reviewing 16 of the packages Wei-Lin has done so far. From memory I cannot
remember any issues with those. If there ever were unclear situations they got resolved
quickly and easy enough to not leave any negative impressions. I am trusting Wei-Lin
to keep up that quality of work and support his application for PPU rights for kernel.

==== Areas of Improvement ====

As we now work with rather high level tooling there is always room for improvement by
investigating and understanding how things work underneath. Also one should never be
afraid of asking before doing an odd looking upload.
